japanese: 彼は、このギターが好き。
english: He likes this guitar.

japanese: 彼は、げんこつで、テーブルをドンと叩いた。
english: He banged on the table with his fist.

japanese: 彼はそれを蹴飛ばした。
english: He kicked it.

japanese: 彼は、きわめて当然のことだが、彼らにとても感謝している。
english: He is, quite rightly, very grateful to them.

japanese: 彼は、かんしゃくを起こしてコップを投げた。
english: He lost his temper and threw a cup.

japanese: 彼は、カッとなった。
english: He flew into a rage.

japanese: 彼は、ガソリンをさらに使わないエンジンを開発した。
english: He devised a new engine to use less gas.

japanese: 彼は、ガスの供給を止められた。
english: He had the gas cut off.

japanese: 彼は、ガールフレンドを無理やりいっぱい付き合わせた。
english: He made his girlfriend go out for a drink with him.

japanese: 彼は、お父さんのビジネスを引き継ぎました。
english: He has taken over his father's business.

japanese: 彼はオレンジが好き。
english: He likes oranges.

japanese: 彼は、オペラはもちろんのこと、童謡すら歌えない。
english: Opera! He cannot even sing children's songs!

japanese: 彼は、おそらく、学位を取る前に死んでしまうだろう。
english: He would probably die before he got his degree.

japanese: 彼は、うだつが上がらないようだ。
english: It seems as he is not going to get ahead.

japanese: 彼は、いわゆる自力でたたきあげた人だ。
english: He is, what is called, a self-made man.

japanese: 彼は、いわば迷える子羊だ。
english: He is, as it were, a stray sheep.

japanese: 彼は、いわば大人の赤ん坊だ。
english: He is, as it were, a grown up baby.

japanese: 彼は、いわば、本の虫だ。
english: He is, so to speak, a bookworm.

japanese: 彼は、いわば、生き字引だ。
english: He is, so to speak, a walking dictionary.

japanese: 彼は、いま来年留学する計画を立てています。
english: He is now planning to study abroad next year.

japanese: 彼はいつ悪事がばれるかと、気が気でなかった。
english: It made him uneasy that someone might find out any second what he was hiding.

japanese: 彼は、いつものように机の上に鍵を置いた。
english: He put the key on the desk as usual.

japanese: 彼は、いっさいアルコールは口にしない。
english: He never touches alcoholic drinks.

japanese: 彼はイタリア料理が好きだ。
english: He likes Italian food.

japanese: 彼はイギリス人です。
english: He's an Englishman.

japanese: 彼は、ある若い医者にかかりました。
english: He was taken care of by a young doctor.

japanese: 彼は、あらゆる努力をしたがむだだった。
english: He made every effort, but to no avail.

japanese: 彼はアメリカ人ですか。
english: Is he American?

japanese: 彼は、アメリカ史を勉強します。
english: He studies American history.

japanese: 彼は、アメリカ国民になった。
english: He became a citizen of the United States.

japanese: 彼は、アメリカへ行こうという考えを捨てた。
english: He gave up the idea of going to America to study.

japanese: 彼は、アメリカで教育を受けたことを自慢している。
english: He is proud of having been educated in the United States.

japanese: 彼は、あの事故が起こっていなかったらなあと思っている。
english: He wishes the accident hadn't happened.

japanese: 彼は、あなたを助ける事ができると私が信じる人です。
english: He is the man who I believe can help you.

japanese: 彼はあなたより２歳年上だ。
english: He is two years older than you.

japanese: 彼は、７時ごろここに来ると私に言った。
english: He told me he would be here about seven.

japanese: 彼は、３月の野ウサギのように狂っているよ。
english: He is as mad as a March hare.

japanese: 彼は、２人のうちで、より背の高い方です。
english: He is the taller of the two boys.

japanese: 彼は１日中働いている。
english: He's been working all day long.

japanese: 彼は、１ヶ月前に彼女に会ったと言った。
english: He said he had seen her a month before.

japanese: 彼は、１９世紀において重要と思われる科学者について研究した。
english: He studied the scientists considered to be the most significant of the 19th century.

japanese: 彼は、１０年前の彼ではありません。
english: He is not what he used to be ten years ago.

japanese: 彼は、１０時に東京に向けて出発する。
english: He leaves for Tokyo at ten.

japanese: 彼は、「彼女はなんてかわいい子だろう」と言った。
english: He said. "What a pretty girl she is!"

japanese: 彼は、「私は今忙しいんだ」と私に言った。
english: He told me that he was busy then.

japanese: 彼は、「なぜ笑っているんだい」と私に尋ねた。
english: He asked me why I was laughing.

japanese: 彼は幸福であったようだ。
english: He seems to have been happy.

japanese: 彼の曖昧な返事は、なおさら彼女をいらいらさせた。
english: His ambiguous reply made her all the more irritated.

japanese: 彼の傲慢さは頭に来るよ。
english: I get mad at his arrogance.

japanese: 彼の傲慢さには我慢できない。
english: I can't be doing with his arrogance.

japanese: 彼の腕を掴んだ。
english: She took him by the arm.

japanese: 彼の話を聞けば君の不安も消えるだろう。
english: His story will banish your fears.

japanese: 彼の話を聞けば、彼がその家の主人だと考えてしまうだろう。
english: If you heard him talk, you would suppose he was the master of the house.

japanese: 彼の話を聞いていて彼女は退屈した。
english: Listening to him, she got tired.

japanese: 彼の話を聞いて彼とは絶対に友達にはなれないだろうとゆう雰囲気がした。
english: His speech left me with the sense that we would never be friends.

japanese: 彼の話を聞いて、彼女はショックを受けた。
english: She was shocked when she heard his story.

japanese: 彼の話を信じますか。
english: Do you believe his story?

japanese: 彼の話を信じる者もいたし、信じない者もいた。
english: Some believed his story, and others did not.

japanese: 彼の話をもっとよく聞くべきでしたね。
english: You should have listened to him more carefully.

japanese: 彼の話を信じたほうがよいであろう。
english: You may as well trust his story.

japanese: 彼の話ぶりに腹が立った。
english: His way of speaking offended me.

japanese: 彼の話をうのみにすることはできなかった。
english: We could not swallow his story.

japanese: 彼の話は要領を得ていた。
english: His speech was to the point.

japanese: 彼の話は要点をはずれている。
english: His talk is off the point.

japanese: 彼の話は本当のように聞こえる。
english: His story rings true.

japanese: 彼の話は本当のはずがない。
english: His story cannot be true.

japanese: 彼の話は本当に聞こえる。
english: His story sounds true.

japanese: 彼の話は本当に違いない。
english: His story must be true.

japanese: 彼の話は本当ではないかもしれない。
english: His story may not be true.

japanese: 彼の話は本当であることがわかった。
english: His story turned out to be true.

japanese: 彼の話は本当だと分かった。
english: His story turned out to be true.

japanese: 彼の話は本当だ。
english: His story is true.

japanese: 彼の話は本当かもしれない。
english: His story may be true.

japanese: 彼の話は本当かな。
english: Is his story true?

japanese: 彼の話は本題からそれた。
english: His story departed from his main theme.

japanese: 彼の話は聞くだけの価値が十分ある。
english: His story is well worth listening to.

japanese: 彼の話は部分的に真実だ。
english: His story is partially true.

japanese: 彼の話は彼女の涙をさそった。
english: His story moved her to tears.

japanese: 彼の話は内容がない。
english: There is no substance in his speech.

japanese: 彼の話は短くて要点のついたものでした。
english: His speech was brief and to the point.

japanese: 彼の話は単純そのものであった。
english: His story was simplicity itself.

japanese: 彼の話は単純そのものだった。
english: His story was simplicity itself.

japanese: 彼の話は多くの点でつじつまが合わない。
english: His story is inconsistent in many places.

japanese: 彼の話は身にしみた。
english: His story hit home.

japanese: 彼の話は真実と違うことが分かった。
english: His story turned out to be false.

japanese: 彼の話は冗談だ。
english: His talk was a mere game.

japanese: 彼の話は少年たちみんなを元気づけた。
english: His speech inspired all the boys.

japanese: 彼の話は事実に反する。
english: What he has said is contrary to fact.

japanese: 彼の話は事実によって裏づけられた。
english: His story was borne out by the facts.

japanese: 彼の話は事実と違うことが分かった。
english: His story turned out to be false.

japanese: 彼の話は私達を非常にたのしませた。
english: His story amused us very much.

japanese: 彼の話は私を恐怖でぞっとさせた。
english: His story thrilled me with horror.

japanese: 彼の話は彼女の話よりおもしろい。
english: His story is much more interesting than hers.

japanese: 彼の話は私たちを笑わせた。
english: His story made us laugh.

japanese: 彼の話は誤りであることがわかった。
english: His story turned out to be false.

japanese: 彼の話は奇妙に聞こえる。
english: His story sounds strange.

japanese: 彼の話は割引して聞いたほうがいい。
english: You should discount his story.

japanese: 彼の話は割り引いて聞いた方がいい。
english: You'd better take his words with a grain of salt.

japanese: 彼の話は我々すべてにとって興味のあるものだった。
english: His story was interesting to us all.

japanese: 彼の話は嘘のように聞こえるが、それでも本当なのです。
english: His story may sound false, but it is true for all that.

japanese: 彼の話は嘘だと分かった。
english: His story turned out to be false.

japanese: 彼の話はもっともらしく聞こえる。
english: His story sounds true.

japanese: 彼の話はみんなを楽しませた。
english: His story amused everyone.

japanese: 彼の話はますます面白くなっていくでしょう。
english: His story will be more and more interesting.

japanese: 彼の話はほぼ真相に近かった。
english: His description approximated to the truth.

japanese: 彼の話はほとんど信用できない。
english: I can hardly believe his story.

japanese: 彼の話はとても要領をえていたので、クラスのみなにわかった。
english: His talk was so much to the purpose that all the class understood it.

japanese: 彼の話はとても面白かった。
english: His story was highly amusing to us.

japanese: 彼の話はでっち上げだ。
english: His story was made up.

japanese: 彼の演説はその場にふさわしいものだった。
english: His speech was suitable for the occasion.

japanese: 彼の話はその場にあまりふさわしくなかった。
english: His speech was not very becoming to the occasion.

japanese: 彼の話はおかしい。
english: His story sounds strange.

japanese: 彼の話はすべての人の好奇心を呼び起こした。
english: His story excited everyone's curiosity.

japanese: 彼の話はうそのように聞こえる。
english: There has a ring of falsehood in his story.

japanese: 彼の話はうそのはずがない。
english: His story can't be false.

japanese: 彼の話はうそであることがわかった。
english: His story turned out to be false.

japanese: 彼の話はいろいろなところへ飛ぶ。
english: He frequently jumps from one topic to another while he is talking.

japanese: 彼の話はいつ聞いても楽しい。
english: His talk is always pleasant to listen to.

japanese: 彼の話はあまりにおかしかったのでみな笑わざるを得なかった。
english: His story was so funny that everyone could not help laughing.

japanese: 彼の話は、奇妙だが、信じられる。
english: His story is strange, but it's believable.

japanese: 彼の話の力点は一生懸命に働かなくてはならないということにあった。
english: The emphasis of his talk was on the need to work hard.

japanese: 彼の話の要点が理解できなかった。
english: She couldn't get the point of his story.

japanese: 彼の話の内容は主題と一致していない。
english: The content of his speech is not relevant to the subject.

japanese: 彼の話の中の、彼が強調した言葉をすべて、私は書き留めた。
english: I wrote down every phrase in his speech that he stressed.

japanese: 彼の話の筋道がわからなくなってしまったようだ。
english: He seems to have lost the thread of the story.

japanese: 彼の話の間生徒は熱心に聞いていた。
english: The pupils listened eagerly during his speech.

japanese: 彼の話の一部は本当だ。
english: Part of his story is true.

japanese: 彼の話にはうんざりですよ。
english: I'm sick and tired of his story.

japanese: 彼の話には一かけらの真実もない。
english: There is not a grain of truth in his story.

japanese: 彼の話にはいくらか真実味がある。
english: His story has some color of truth in it.

japanese: 彼の話で僕は昔のことを思い出します。
english: His story puts me in mind of my past days.

japanese: 彼の話で僕は感動した。
english: My heart was touched by his story.

japanese: 彼の話で彼女の悲しみはまぎれた。
english: His talk distracted her from grief.

japanese: 彼の話で私は疑いを持った。
english: His story aroused my suspicion.

japanese: 彼の話で私たちは何時間も楽しんだ。
english: His stories entertained us for hours.

japanese: 彼の話で仕事を仕上げる気がなくなった。
english: His speech indisposed us to finish the work any more.

japanese: 彼の話す英語の速いことと言ったら。
english: How fast he speaks English!

japanese: 彼の話すのを見たら、彼のことを女の子と思うかもしれません。
english: To hear him talk, you might take him for a girl.

japanese: 彼の話し方は有名な作家の注意をひいた。
english: The way he spoke attracted the attention of a famous writer.

japanese: 彼の話し方は嫌いだ。
english: I don't like the way he speaks.

japanese: 彼の話し方は無礼といってもよいほどに単刀直入だ。
english: His manner of speaking is direct to the point of rudeness.

japanese: 彼の話し方はたいへん洗練されている。
english: His speech is very refined.

japanese: 彼の話し方にユーモアがあるのは、彼特有のなまりから来ている。
english: The humor of his speech is derived from his peculiar local accent.

japanese: 彼の話し方には抑揚が欠けている。
english: Intonation is absent in his way of speaking.

japanese: 彼の話し方が気にいらないのです。
english: I don't like his way of talking.

japanese: 彼の話し方から分かることだが、彼は先生だ。
english: He is a teacher, as is clear from his way of talking.

japanese: 彼の話し方が嫌なの。
english: I don't like the way he talks.

japanese: 彼の話を聞くのはとてもおもしろいと思った。
english: I found listening to him very interesting.

japanese: 彼の話を聞くのはおもしろい。
english: It is very interesting to listen to him.

japanese: 彼の話をもっとよく聞くべきだった。
english: You should have listened to him more carefully.

japanese: 彼の話は作りごとだったとわかった。
english: What he had said proved to be a myth.

japanese: 彼の話は胸にしみじみこたえた。
english: His story hit home.

japanese: 彼の話はばかばかしいと言ってもいいくらいだった。
english: His speech verged on the ridiculous.

japanese: 彼の話はそうとう大袈裟だ。
english: His story is highly colored.

japanese: 彼の話に私達はしらけてしまった。
english: His speech turned us off.

japanese: 彼の話に引き込まれるのを感じた。
english: I felt drawn to his story.

japanese: 彼の話している間、その様子が心に浮かびました。
english: As he spoke, pictures came into my mind.

japanese: 彼の話が恐ろしく退屈になってきた。
english: His speech got awfully boring.

japanese: 彼の話からその見聞の広さがうかがわれた。
english: His talk led me to believe that he knows a great deal.

japanese: 彼の話がどこまで本当か私にはわからない。
english: I cannot say how far his story is true.

japanese: 彼の論法を認めることはできない。
english: I cannot appreciate his logic.

japanese: 彼の論文は全体的にみて満足のいくものでした。
english: His paper was, on the whole, satisfactory.

japanese: 彼の論文は申し分ない。
english: His thesis leaves nothing to be desired.

japanese: 彼の論文は小説のように読める。
english: His paper reads like a novel.

japanese: 彼の論文は私の論文より優れている。
english: His paper is superior to mine.

japanese: 彼の論文は核家族における幼児虐待という問題に対処しようとするものである。
english: His paper confronts the question of child abuse in nuclear families.

japanese: 彼の論文は意味不明。第一、主題が曖昧だ。
english: His thesis doesn't make sense. To begin with, its theme is obscure.

japanese: 彼の論文の方が私の論文よりも優れている。
english: His paper is superior to mine.

japanese: 彼の論文には決して満足出来ない。
english: His paper is far from satisfactory.

japanese: 彼の論文の方が私のよりいい。
english: His paper is superior to mine.

japanese: 彼の礼儀作法を見れば彼が紳士であることが分かる。
english: His manners proclaim him a gentleman.

japanese: 彼の礼儀は紳士らしくない。
english: His manners are not those of a gentleman.

japanese: 彼の冷静な言葉で私の恐怖は和らいだ。
english: His calm words allayed my fear.

japanese: 彼の冷酷な言葉が今でも私の心の中でうずいている。
english: His bitter words still rankle in my mind.

japanese: 彼の冷たさが彼の友人を疎遠にさせてしまった。
english: His coolness has alienated his friends.

japanese: 彼の目は涙でぬれている。
english: His eyes are bathed in tears.

japanese: 彼の涙に感動した。
english: I was moved by his tears.

japanese: 彼の隣人が彼女の留守の間子供たちの世話をするだろう。
english: His neighbor will care for the children while she is away.

japanese: 彼の良さは外見では分からない。
english: You can't know his merits by his appearance.

japanese: 彼の両親を別にすると、誰もその容疑者を擁護しないだろう。
english: Apart from his parents, nobody would defend the suspect.

japanese: 彼の両親は毎週日曜日に教会へお祈りに行きます。
english: His parents go to church every Sunday.

japanese: 彼の両親は別として、誰も彼を余りよく知らない。
english: Apart from his parents, no one knows him very well.

japanese: 彼の両親は別にして、誰も彼のことをよく知らない。
english: Apart from his parents, no one knows him well.

japanese: 彼の両親は彼を散歩に連れて行った。
english: His parents took him for a walk.

japanese: 彼の両親は彼の大学教育に備えて貯蓄をしている。
english: His parents are saving for his college education.

japanese: 彼の両親は彼の旅行に賛成だった。
english: His parents were in favor of his trip.

japanese: 彼の両親は彼の合格を聞いて喜んだ。
english: His parents were glad at his success in the examination.

japanese: 彼の両親は彼のわがままに寛大だ。
english: His parents are tolerant of his self-indulgence.

japanese: 彼の両親は彼に期待し過ぎている。
english: His parents expect too much of him.

japanese: 彼の両親は彼に大学へ行くように言った。
english: His parents told him to get into a university.

japanese: 彼の両親は彼が大学へ行くように言った。
english: His parents told him to get into a university.

japanese: 彼の両親は彼に何かすてきなものを買ってやった。
english: His parents bought him something nice.

japanese: 彼の両親は上京する予定です。
english: Both of his parents are coming to Tokyo.

japanese: 彼の両親はともに健在です。
english: Both of his parents are well.

japanese: 彼の両親はホテルを経営していた。
english: His parents ran a hotel.

japanese: 彼の両親は助けを求める者は誰でも助けた。
english: His parents helped whoever asked for their help.

japanese: 彼の両親はその婚約に賛成だ。
english: His parents approve of the engagement.

japanese: 彼の両親はたいへん貧乏だったので、むすこを大学にやれなかった。
english: His parents were too poor to send their son to college.

japanese: 彼の両親は２人ともなくなっている。
english: Both his parents are dead.

japanese: 彼の両親はお百姓でした。
english: His parents were farmers.

japanese: 彼の両親はさておき、彼のことをよく知っている人はいない。
english: Apart from his parents, no one knows him well.

japanese: 彼の両親は、彼の成功を喜んだ。

japanese: 彼の忠告が骨身に染みた。
english: His advice cut me to the quick.

japanese: 彼の忠告がなかったならば、彼女は飛行機でロンドンへ行かなかっただろう。
english: If it had not been for his advice, she would not have flown to London.

japanese: 彼の仲間は明らかに彼の裕福さを妬んでいた。
english: Obviously, his companions were jealous of his wealth.

japanese: 彼の遅れは弁解の余地はない。
english: There's no excuse for his delay.

japanese: 彼の地理学の知識は乏しい。
english: His knowledge of geography is poor.

japanese: 彼の知能は普通の子より上である。
english: His mental level is higher than the average boy's.

japanese: 彼の知人が田舎で雑貨屋を経営している。
english: His acquaintance runs a grocery in the country.

japanese: 彼の知事としての任期は来年の一月に切れる。
english: His term of office as governor expires next January.

japanese: 彼の知己を得たのは幸いだった。
english: I was fortunate to make his acquaintance.

japanese: 彼の誕生日はたまたま私の誕生日と同じです。
english: His birthday just happens to be the same as mine.

japanese: 彼の誕生日は、８月２１日です。
english: His birthday is August 21st.

japanese: 彼の誕生日のために何を買ったら良いのか分からない。
english: I am at a loss what to buy him for his birthday.

japanese: 彼の誕生日に私は彼が住んでいる町に電車で行きました。
english: On his birthday, I took a train to the town in which he lived.

japanese: 彼の誕生日だったのをほとんど忘れそうだった。
english: I almost forgot that it was his birthday.

japanese: 彼の誕生パーティーは明日３時に開かれる予定です。
english: His birthday party is to be held at three tomorrow.

japanese: 彼の短気は手に負えない。
english: He has an uncontrollable temper.

japanese: 彼の第一の趣味であるヨットに彼の給料の大部分が費やされる。
english: Sailing a boat, his chief hobby, costs him most of his salary.

japanese: 彼の大望は弁護士になることだ。
english: His ambition is to be a lawyer.

japanese: 彼の大風呂敷はいつものこと。
english: He is always talking big.

japanese: 彼の大胆な決意のおかげで危機を乗り越えることができた。
english: Thanks to his bold decision, he was able to ride out the crisis.

japanese: 彼の大胆な計画は大きな論争を巻き起こした。
english: His bold plan gave rise to much controversy.

japanese: 彼の大勝利に相手は落胆した。
english: The partner was discouraged to his large victory.

japanese: 彼の大勝利に競争相手は落胆した。
english: His rival was discouraged by his triumph.

japanese: 彼の大学は市で一番の景色に恵まれている。
english: His college boasts the finest view in the city.

japanese: 彼の大きな声が私の注意をひいた。
english: His loud voice drew my attention.

japanese: 彼の大きさはどのくらいですか。
english: How big is he?

japanese: 彼の退屈な演説を聞くといらいらする。
english: His speech irritates me.

japanese: 彼の態度を見習いなさい。
english: You should imitate his behavior.

japanese: 彼の態度をどう思いますか。
english: What do you think of his attitude?

japanese: 彼の態度は無礼だとは言えないが無作法だ。
english: He is impolite, not to say rude.

japanese: 彼の態度は自分の意図を表している。
english: His behavior is significant of his intentions.

japanese: 彼の態度は紳士の態度ではありません。
english: His manners aren't those of a gentleman.

japanese: 彼の態度は決して丁重ではない。
english: His attitude is by no means polite.

japanese: 彼の態度は軍人らしく堅苦しかった。
english: His bearing was stiff and military.

japanese: 彼の態度は感じのよいものとはとても言えなかった。
english: His manners were anything but pleasant.

japanese: 彼の態度はやさしかった。
english: His manner to us was kind.

japanese: 彼の態度はすこぶる無骨だ。
english: He is very blunt in his manner.

japanese: 彼の態度は１８０度変わった。
english: He has turned 180 degrees around.

japanese: 彼の態度に問題はない。
english: I don't have a problem with his attitude.

japanese: 彼の態度には銀行家らしいところが全くない。
english: There is nothing of the banker in his bearing.

japanese: 彼の態度には疑いをはさむ余地がない。
english: His behavior is above suspicion.

japanese: 彼の態度にはこれという変化は見られない。
english: He's shown no appreciable change of attitude.

japanese: 彼の態度にはごう慢なところがある。
english: His manner partakes of insolence.

japanese: 彼の態度にはうんざりだ。
english: His attitude disgusts me.

japanese: 彼の態度が原因で友達が離れていった。
english: His behavior alienated his friends.

japanese: 彼の態度から彼が地方出身なことは明らかだ。
english: His manner marks him as a provincial.

japanese: 彼の怠惰は将来に対する悪い前兆だった。
english: His laziness boded ill for the future.

japanese: 彼の怠惰にはもうこれ以上我慢することができない。
english: I cannot put up with his idleness any longer.

japanese: 彼の怠惰にはもはや我慢できない。
english: I cannot put up with his idleness any longer.

japanese: 彼の怠惰が失敗という結果になったのも無理はない。
english: His idleness resulted in the failure, and with reason.

japanese: 彼の怠け癖は我慢の限界を越える。
english: His laziness is past the margin of endurance.

japanese: 彼の怠けぶりを許せない。
english: I can't excuse his laziness.

japanese: 彼の怠けぐせは、もう手に負えない。
english: I'm at a loss for what to do with him. He's so lazy.

japanese: 彼の体力は衰えてきた。
english: His powers are failing.

japanese: 彼の体力は徐々に衰えた。
english: His strength slowly declined.

japanese: 彼の体力は弱まりつつある。
english: His strength is waning.

japanese: 彼の体重は１０年前の２倍だ。
english: His weight is double what it was ten years ago.

japanese: 彼の体温は正常だ。
english: His temperature is normal.

japanese: 彼の体は熱でほてってきた。
english: He was burning with fever.

japanese: 彼の体は興奮で震えた。
english: His body shivered with excitement.

japanese: 彼の体つきはいかにも強そうだった。
english: His body showed every mark of his strength.

japanese: 彼の打率は３割４分３厘で、ホームランは５４本であった。
english: He batted .343 with 54 home runs.

japanese: 彼の唾の吐き方が我慢できない。
english: I can't put up with the way he spits.

japanese: 彼の多様な興味が何事にも広い見識を彼にもたらします。
english: His broad interests bring him broad views on everything.

japanese: 彼の多くの収入が毎年海外に旅行することを可能にしています。
english: His large income enables him to travel abroad every year.

japanese: 彼の他の著作と違い、この本は科学者達のためのものではなかった。
english: Unlike his other writings, this book was not for scientists.

japanese: 彼の存在が認められた。
english: His existence was recognized.

japanese: 彼の卒業論文は私のと関係がある。
english: His thesis is related to mine.

japanese: 彼の袖が油まみれのなべに触れた。
english: His sleeve touched the greasy pan.

japanese: 彼の足は長い。
english: He has long legs.

japanese: 彼の足はワニにかまれた。
english: His leg was bitten by a crocodile.

japanese: 彼の足の状態は深刻でしたが、運良く快方に向かいました。
english: His leg was in critical condition, but fortunately it got better.

japanese: 彼の息子達のどちらとも彼の家業を継ぎたがらない。
english: Neither of his sons wants to succeed to his family business.

japanese: 彼の息子は弁護士になりたがっている。
english: His son wants to be a lawyer.

japanese: 彼の息子は服役中である。
english: His son is serving his sentence.

japanese: 彼の息子は町で迷った。
english: His son was lost in the town.

japanese: 彼の息子は怠け者で役に立たない。
english: His son is lazy and good for nothing.

japanese: 彼の息子は自分の名前を書くことすらできない。
english: His son cannot so much as write his own name.

japanese: 彼の息子は今大学に在学中です。
english: His son is in college now.

japanese: 彼の息子は恐怖で震えた。
english: His son trembled with fear.

japanese: 彼の息子は街で道に迷った。
english: His son was lost in the town.

japanese: 彼の息子は崖から落ちた。
english: His son fell over the cliff.

japanese: 彼の息子は偉大な科学者になった。
english: His son became a great scientist.

japanese: 彼の息子はどうなったか。
english: What has become of his son?

japanese: 彼の息子は８歳だ。
english: His son is eight years old.

japanese: 彼の息子たちはしつけが、ちゃんとできていない。
english: His sons are not properly brought up.

japanese: 彼の息子たちが良い子であるのは間違いない。
english: There is no doubt that his sons are good boys.

japanese: 彼の息子だけでなく娘も有名であった。
english: His daughter, as well as his son, was famous.

japanese: 彼の息子さんは有名なピアニストになった。
english: His son became a famous pianist.

japanese: 彼の息子が死んだという知らせはとてもショックだった。
english: The news of his son's death was a great shock.

japanese: 彼の息子が死んだという知らせは、とてもショッキングだった。
english: The news of his son's death was a great shock.

japanese: 彼の息子が工場の経営を引き受けた。
english: His son took on the management of the factory.

japanese: 彼の贈り物はぶどう酒一瓶である。
english: His present is a bottle of wine.

japanese: 彼の葬式に行かなかった事を後悔している。
english: I feel bad about not having gone to his funeral.

japanese: 彼の葬式には大勢の人が参列した。
english: A great many people attended his funeral.

japanese: 彼の葬式には出なかった。
english: I didn't attend his funeral.

japanese: 彼の双子の妹たちを区別することができない。
english: I can't tell his twin sisters apart.

japanese: 彼の粗野な冗談にジェーンは腹を立てた。
english: His crude jokes made Jane angry.

japanese: 彼の祖父は年の割にまだたいへん健康だ。
english: His grandfather is still very healthy for his age.

japanese: 彼の祖父は息子の仕送りで生活している。
english: His grandfather lives on an allowance from his son.

japanese: 彼の祖父は静かに亡くなった。
english: His grandfather passed away peacefully.

japanese: 彼の祖父は高級軍人だった。
english: His grandfather was a soldier of high degree.

japanese: 彼の祖父は２人ともなくなっている。
english: Both his grandfathers are dead.

japanese: 彼の祖父にちなんで名前を付けられたに違いない。
english: He must have been named after his grandfather.

japanese: 彼の全精力はその実験に捧げられた。
english: All his energies were devoted to the experiment.

japanese: 彼の全財産を投じてもまだ足りまい。
english: Investing all his fortune would not be enough.

japanese: 彼の善良な性格は、家の中の不和を沈める役割を果たすように見える。
english: His good nature seems to fulfill the role of reducing the family's trouble.

japanese: 彼の前歴について私たちは調査した。
english: We made inquiries into his past.

japanese: 彼の前途は洋々たるものだ。
english: A great future is reserved for him.

japanese: 彼の前途は君が思うほど有望ではない。
english: His prospects are not so rosy as you suppose.

japanese: 彼の前途には一筋の希望の光もなかった。
english: There was not a ray of hope before him.

japanese: 彼の前に１人の男がいた。
english: In front of him was man.

japanese: 彼の前では煙草を吸わない方がいいですよ。
english: You should better not smoke in his presence.

japanese: 彼の前でそのことを話さないでください。
english: Don't talk about it in his presence.

japanese: 彼の前でそのことを口にするな。
english: Don't talk about it in front of him.

japanese: 彼の船は無人島に漂流した。
english: His boat was washed ashore on a desert island.

japanese: 彼の専門的知識の欠陥が昇進を妨げた。
english: His lack of technical knowledge precluded him from promotion.

japanese: 彼の先祖はアイルランドからそこに行った。
english: His ancestors went there from Ireland.

japanese: 彼の先生でさえも彼の言うことを理解しなかった。
english: Even his teacher didn't understand him.

japanese: 彼の絶え間無い努力が平和をもたらした。
english: His constant efforts brought about peace.

japanese: 彼の絶え間のない自慢はすべての人を怒らせた。
english: His continual boasting gave offense to everybody.

japanese: 彼の絶え間ない侮辱が彼女の怒りを掻き立てた。
english: His constant insults aroused her anger.

japanese: 彼の説明は要点を外れています。
english: His explanation is beside the point.

japanese: 彼の説明は説得力に欠けている。
english: His explanation is unconvincing.

japanese: 彼の説明は私には全然理解できなかった。
english: His explanation was quite above me.

japanese: 彼の説明は誤りであると判明した。
english: What he said turned out to be false.

japanese: 彼の説明はわかりにくかった。
english: His explanation didn't come across well.

japanese: 彼の説明はまったく理屈に合わない。
english: His explanation doesn't make sense at all.

japanese: 彼の説明はあいまいだ。
english: His explanation is not clear.

japanese: 彼の説明はけっして満足できるものではなかった。
english: His explanation was by no means satisfactory.

japanese: 彼の説明はあいまいすぎていて分からない。
english: His explanation is too obscure to understand.

japanese: 彼の説明は、決して満足のいくものではない。
english: His explanation is far from satisfactory.

japanese: 彼の説明に何か補足することがありますか。
english: Do you have anything to add to his explanation?

japanese: 彼の説明で第１の問題は解決したが、私は第２の問題については依然混乱していた。
english: His explanation cleared up the first problem, but I was still confused about the second.

japanese: 彼の説教はとても長い。
english: His lecture is very long.

japanese: 彼の説明、舌足らずでよく分からなかった。
english: His explanation was too sketchy. I didn't understand it.

japanese: 彼の説教にはうんざりだ。
english: I'm fed up with him always preaching to me.

japanese: 彼の税金の申告は細かく調べられても大丈夫なのかしら。
english: I wonder if his tax returns will stand close examination.

japanese: 彼の誠実さを疑うひともいた。
english: Some people questioned his honesty.

japanese: 彼の誠実さを疑うのなら彼に援助を求めるな。
english: If you question his sincerity, do not ask for his help.

japanese: 彼の声明文は次の通りだ。
english: His statement runs as follows.

japanese: 彼の声明は疑いの余地がない。
english: His statement admits of no doubt.

japanese: 彼の声を耳にしたとたんに、彼女は恐ろしくて震えた。
english: Immediately she heard his voice, she trembled with fear.

japanese: 彼の声は怒りで震えた。
english: His voice quavered with anger.

japanese: 彼の声は大きい。
english: He has a loud voice.

japanese: 彼の声は小さくなってささやき声になった。
english: His voice dropped to a whisper.

japanese: 彼の声は私たちの耳まで達した。
english: His voice reached our ears.

japanese: 彼の声は気の抜けたようで、興奮を感じさせなかった。
english: His voice was flat and lacked enthusiasm.

japanese: 彼の声は顔と合わない。
english: His voice doesn't go with his appearance.

japanese: 彼の声はよく通る。
english: His voice carries very well.

japanese: 彼の声はその叫びでかき消された。
english: His voice was drowned by the yells.

japanese: 彼の声に多少怒りの響きがあった。
english: There was a suggestion of anger in his voice.

japanese: 彼の声には憂鬱な調子が感じられた。
english: We sensed a melancholy note in his voice.

japanese: 彼の声には優しい気づかいが満ちていた。
english: His voice was full of tender concern.

japanese: 彼の声には底力がある。
english: He has a deep voice.

japanese: 彼の声が聞こえたので、私はふりむいた。
english: Hearing his voice, I turned around.

japanese: 彼の声が騒音にも負けずに聞こえた。
english: His voice was heard above the din.

japanese: 彼の聖人ぶった態度が気にいらない。
english: I don't like his holier-than-thou attitude.

japanese: 彼の精神発達は遅かった。
english: His mental development was slow.

japanese: 彼の精神状態を考慮に入れるべきだ。
english: You should take account of his mental condition.

japanese: 彼の精神の発達は遅かった。
english: His mental development was slow.

japanese: 彼の生命は私の手中にある。
english: His life is in my hands.

japanese: 彼の生命は危険な状態にあると思います。
english: I think his life is in danger.

japanese: 彼の生活は彼女にかかっている。
english: His life rests on her.

japanese: 彼の生活は心配がない。
english: His life is free from care.

japanese: 彼の生活は順調だった。
english: His life ran smoothly.

japanese: 彼の生活は言い表すことのできないほど悲惨なものだった。
english: His life was miserable beyond description.

japanese: 彼の生活はのんきだ。
english: His life is free from care.

japanese: 彼の生涯は長い失敗の連続だった。
english: His life was a long series of failures.

japanese: 彼の生涯はほぼ１世紀にわたった。
english: His life spanned nearly a century.

japanese: 彼の生涯はすばらしいものだった。
english: His was a remarkable life.

japanese: 彼の生まれた日は雨だった。
english: The day that he was born was rainy.

japanese: 彼の正直には少しの疑いもない。
english: There is not a shadow of doubt about his honesty.

japanese: 彼の正直さは大いに賞賛の価値がある。
english: His honesty is worthy of great praise.

japanese: 彼の正直さは見上げたものだ。
english: His honesty does him credit.

japanese: 彼の政敵すべてが彼の葬儀に現れた。
english: All his political enemies showed themselves at his funeral.

japanese: 彼の正しいのはあきらかだ。
english: It is obvious that he is right.

japanese: 彼の正直さは疑いの余地が無い。
english: His honesty does not have the room of doubt.

japanese: 彼の政策は時代に先んじていた。
english: His policy was in advance of his times.

japanese: 彼の政治家としての生涯は終わった。
english: His political career has ended.

japanese: 彼の政治寿命はもうない。
english: His days as a politician are numbered.

japanese: 彼の政策は国民の福祉に重点を置く。
english: His policy puts the accent on national welfare.

japanese: 彼の成功を切望した。
english: I was anxious for his success.

japanese: 彼の政権はきっと崩壊する。
english: His regime is bound to collapse.

japanese: 彼の成功を告げられて、私はうれし泣きしそうになった。
english: Told about his success, I almost cried for joy.

japanese: 彼の成功を祈って乾杯しよう。
english: Let's drink to his success.

japanese: 彼の成功を喜んでいる。
english: She's pleased at his success.

japanese: 彼の成功を確信している。
english: I am sure of his success.

japanese: 彼の成功は両親のおかげです。
english: He owes his success to his parents.
